comments:
Thanks for the quick response, Jenkins update was 2.452.2 -> 2.462.3. Here is a snippet of ours which always worked before the update:

\xa0
def html_files = [device_type + '-report.html', device_type + '-testautomation-link.html']

\xa0 \xa0 publishHTML target: [
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 allowMissing: false,
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 alwaysLinkToLastBuild: false,
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 keepAll: true,
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 reportDir: '.',
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 reportFiles: html_files.join(', '),
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 reportName: device_type + '-TestReport' + test_verdict
\xa0 \xa0 ]
\xa0*test_verdict and device_type* comes from a definition above which is not visible in the snippet so please ignore this

Also a very plain implementation( See below ) shows the same:

\xa0
\xa0 \xa0 publishHTML target: [
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 allowMissing: false,
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 alwaysLinkToLastBuild: false,
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 keepAll: true,
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 reportDir: '.',
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 reportFiles: report.html
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 reportName: TestReport
\xa0 \xa0 ]

\xa0

Tried also with *useWrapperFileDirectly: true* and no luck..

(my title) but none of the HTML files.', 'updateAuthor': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=markewaite', 'name': 'markewaite', 'key': 'markewaite', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '24x24': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '16x16': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '32x32': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478'}, 'displayName': 'Mark Waite', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'America/Denver'}, 'created': '2024-11-21T16:37:22.000+0000', 'updated': '2024-11-21T16:37:22.000+0000'}, {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/issue/223176/comment/450801', 'id': '450801', 'author': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=ravishan', 'name': 'ravishan', 'key': 'ravishan', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=48', '24x24': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=24', '16x16': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=16', '32x32': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=32'}, 'displayName': 'Shreyas Ravishankar', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'UTC'}, 'body': 'Is this recommended? I mean why would it be greyed out if a downgrade was an option? the release 1.37 Requires Jenkins 2.440.3 so thought this should be offered.\xa0', 'updateAuthor': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=ravishan', 'name': 'ravishan', 'key': 'ravishan', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=48', '24x24': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=24', '16x16': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=16', '32x32': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=32'}, 'displayName': 'Shreyas Ravishankar', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'UTC'}, 'created': '2024-11-21T16:39:24.000+0000', 'updated': '2024-11-21T16:39:24.000+0000'}, {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/issue/223176/comment/450802', 'id': '450802', 'author': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=markewaite', 'name': 'markewaite', 'key': 'markewaite', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '24x24': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '16x16': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '32x32': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478'}, 'displayName': 'Mark Waite', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'America/Denver'}, 'body': 'Yes, it is safe.  Recommended is too strong, since it assumes that you know the plugin you're adding will work.  I know it will work.

The

button is only offered from the plugin manager if it detects a local copy of the previous plugin.  In this case, I know that 1.36 works with your version of Jenkins, since I've been testing with that version.', 'updateAuthor': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=markewaite', 'name': 'markewaite', 'key': 'markewaite', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '24x24': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '16x16': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '32x32': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478'}, 'displayName': 'Mark Waite', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'America/Denver'}, 'created': '2024-11-21T16:53:19.000+0000', 'updated': '2024-11-21T16:54:00.000+0000'}, {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/issue/223176/comment/450821', 'id': '450821', 'author': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=ravishan', 'name': 'ravishan', 'key': 'ravishan', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=48', '24x24': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=24', '16x16': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=16', '32x32': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=32'}, 'displayName': 'Shreyas Ravishankar', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'UTC'}, 'body': 'Downgrading works. Thanks a lot. Hopefully will be fixed upstream soon.\xa0', 'updateAuthor': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=ravishan', 'name': 'ravishan', 'key': 'ravishan', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=48', '24x24': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=24', '16x16': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=16', '32x32': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=32'}, 'displayName': 'Shreyas Ravishankar', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'UTC'}, 'created': '2024-11-22T12:50:49.000+0000', 'updated': '2024-11-22T12:50:49.000+0000'}, {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/issue/223176/comment/450822', 'id': '450822', 'author': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=markewaite', 'name': 'markewaite', 'key': 'markewaite', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '24x24': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '16x16': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '32x32': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478'}, 'displayName': 'Mark Waite', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'America/Denver'}, 'body': 'Thanks for checking.  I think that means you've confirmed that:

* Jenkins 2.462.3 with htmlpublisher 1.37 does not show links to the individual HTML results pages on the dropdown menu from the build history
* Jenkins 2.462.3 with htmlpublisher 1.36 shows links to the individual HTML results pages on the dropdown menu from the build history
* Jenkins 2.452.2 with htmlpublisher 1.36 shows links to the individual HTML results pages on the dropdown menu from the build history

Are those three items correct?

Assuming they are correct, then it seems that the change happened in htmlpublisher 1.37.  Unfortunately, I still can't show links to the individual HTML results pages on the dropdown menu from the build history with htmlpublisher 1.36 using either Jenkins 2.452.4 or Jenkins 2.462.3.  A fix is unlikely unless a plugin maintainer can duplicate the issue.

Can you provide the detailed list of plugins that are installed using the [plugin version reporting script|https://www.jenkins.io/participate/report-issue/#what-information-to-provide-for-environment-and-description] in the Jenkins script console (

).  If that is not enough, then you may need to include the {{config.xml}} from the JENKINS_HOME directory and the full Pipeline script that is used to generate that list.', 'updateAuthor': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=markewaite', 'name': 'markewaite', 'key': 'markewaite', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '24x24': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '16x16': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478', '32x32': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=markewaite&avatarId=12478'}, 'displayName': 'Mark Waite', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'America/Denver'}, 'created': '2024-11-22T13:21:06.000+0000', 'updated': '2024-11-22T13:21:52.000+0000'}, {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/issue/223176/comment/450826', 'id': '450826', 'author': {'self': 'https://issues.jenkins.io/rest/api/2/user?username=ravishan', 'name': 'ravishan', 'key': 'ravishan', 'avatarUrls': {'48x48': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=48', '24x24': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=24', '16x16': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=16', '32x32': 'https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/3e8f5a9b8b1e4f6b176be9d5d12d7bdc?d=mm&s=32'}, 'displayName': 'Shreyas Ravishankar', 'active': True, 'timeZone': 'UTC'}, 'body': 'I can confirm your assumptions.\xa0
